metadata.intent: Establish master definition for character 'ACT TWO'
metadata.rationale: Extracted from canonical script and scene co-occurrence data.

data.description: ACT TWO is a structural/narrative marker in the script, denoting the beginning of the second act of the story. It is not a character in the traditional sense but a dramatic division label that signals a transition in the narrative following the end of Act One.
data.dialogue_summary: ACT TWO has no dialogue. It is a non-speaking structural label used to divide the script into acts.

inferred_traits.rationale: The text 'ACT TWO' appears immediately after 'END OF ACT ONE', clearly functioning as a script formatting device to mark the transition between the first and second acts of the story.

In conventional dramatic structure, Act Two typically introduces new complications or escalates existing conflicts, as suggested by the tense cliffhanger moment preceding it (Dante locked out, rushing toward the cab).
inferred_traits.value: Signals escalation or shift in story direction

data.name: ACT TWO
